Name: 1-HEXENE
Description: 1-hexene is an alkene that is hexane carrying a double bond at position 1.

environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Hansch C et al; Exploring QSAR Fundamentals and Applications in Chemistry and Biology. Washington, DC: Amer Chem Soc (1995) (2) Meylan WM et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 18: 664-672 (1999) (3) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF of 81 was calculated for 1-hexene(SRC), using a log Kow of 3.39(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is moderate.

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Chemicals Inspection and Testing Institute; Japan Chemical Industry Ecology - Toxicology and Information Center. ISBN 4-89074-101-1 (1992) (2) Boethling RS et al; Environ Sci Technol 28: 459-65 (1994)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: Using an activated sludge and the Japanese MITI test, 67-98% of the theoretical BOD was achieved for 1-hexene during a 4 week incubation period(1). 1-Hexene's linear hydrocarbon structure would suggest that biodegradation is an important process in soil and water(2).

fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: 1-Hexene was identified, not quantified, in mussels near Holbaek, Holland(1).

logP.References: Hansch, C., Leo, A., D. Hoekman. Exploring QSAR - Hydrophobic, Electronic, and Steric Constants. Washington, DC: American Chemical Society., 1995., p. 23

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: The toxicity of shale oil components, including 1-hexene, to a mixed marine bacterial culture was assessed using an acute static bioassay protocol. Of the aliphatic cmpd studied, only 1-hexene exerted a toxic effect with a log EC10 of -0.49 m/l. However, the calc log EC15 of 0.46 indicates a value > 100% saturation, therefore, 1-hexene was designated not toxic up to levels of 100% saturation in sea water.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clayton, G.D., F.E. Clayton (eds.) Patty's Industrial Hygiene and Toxicology. Volumes 2A, 2B, 2C, 2D, 2E, 2F: Toxicology. 4th ed. New York, NY: John Wiley & Sons Inc., 1993-1994., p. 1249
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: The minimal concentration causing CNS depression in mice was 2.9% or 29,100 ppm, and the minimal fatal concentration was 4.08% or 40,800 ppm.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Hansch C et al; Exploring QSAR Fundamentals and Applications in Chemistry and Biology. Washington, DC: Amer Chem Soc (1995) (2) Lyman WJ et al; Handbook of Chemical Property Estimation Methods. Washington, DC: Amer Chem Soc pp. 4-9 (1990) (3) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: The Koc of 1-hexene is estimated as 1,660(SRC), using a log Kow of 3.39(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this estimated Koc value suggests that 1-hexene is expected to have low mobility in soil.
